item.title: Sturgeon urges UK government to reassess Cambo oil field plan
item.description: The first minister says proposals should be re-examined due to the severity of the climate emergency.

item.title: Covid in Scotland: Hospitals under more pressure than ever, say medics
item.description: Staff at Glasgow's Queen Elizabeth Hospital tell BBC Scotland demand is unlike anything they have seen before.

item.title: New guidance on supporting transgender pupils in schools
item.description: The Scottish government says the advice is not prescriptive and does not promote transitioning.

item.title: 'My brother died horrifically - it can't be in vain'
item.description: A woman calls for an inquiry into the death of her brother who was murdered by a newly-released prisoner.

item.title: Large rise in ambulance waiting times for serious cases
item.description: Waiting times over 10 minutes minutes double, but there was also an increase in the quickest responses.

item.title: SSPCA call for Dangerous Dogs Act to judge 'deeds not breeds'
item.description: Campaigners say certain breeds should be rehomed rather than put down if they go into care.

item.title: Man dies and three injured in A74(M) crash
item.description: The crash involved two cars travelling north and one going south on the A74(M) in South Lanarkshire.

item.title: Trains stop for one minute to remember Stonehaven crash victims
item.description: Three people died when the 06:38 Aberdeen to Glasgow service crashed into a landslide near Stonehaven a year ago.

item.title: Work on new Edinburgh concert hall set to start next year
item.description: A scaled-back design means the backers of Edinburgh's Dunard Centre are hopeful construction can begin in 2022.

item.title: Scotland's first electric-powered aircraft begins Orkney test flights
item.description: It is hoped the hybrid aircraft could pave the way for inter-island and short-haul flights with greener technologies.

item.title: Kinloch Castle: 'Right owner' sought for historic Rum lodge
item.description: NatureScot says it has been working to find a "beneficial owner" of Rum's Kinloch Castle over the past few years.

item.title: Murder probe after man's body found at fire in Glasgow park
item.description: Police believe the 31-year-old, whose remains were discovered in a Glasgow park, was the victim of a targeted attack.

item.title: Covid in Scotland: Where are the latest cases?
item.description: A daily update on the number and location of coronavirus cases in Scotland.

item.title: Covid in Scotland: How have the rules changed?
item.description: Scotland's levels system of restrictions have come to an end - but what does that mean people can do?

item.title: Is the coronavirus pandemic over at last?
item.description: As Scotland loosens most of its remaining restrictions, is the devastating pandemic finally at an end?

item.title: Covid in Scotland: Your questions answered on life after level zero
item.description: Readers have been sending in their questions about what the ending of more Covid rules means for them.

item.title: Covid in Scotland: Do I need a vaccine certificate to travel?
item.description: The documents could be used in an international vaccine passport programme enabling foreign travel.

item.title: Covid in Scotland: Are young people slowing the vaccine drive?
item.description: Concerns have been raised about vaccine uptake among younger adults, but are they less likely to want a jab? Here, we examine the statistics.

item.title: Covid map: Coronavirus cases, deaths, vaccinations by country
item.description: Key maps and charts explaining how the virus has spread around the world.

item.title: 'I'm going into S6 and have never done a proper exam'
item.description: BBC Scotland speaks to pupils in Aberdeenshire who share their results and views on the grading process.

item.title: What would an SNP-Green deal mean for Scotland?
item.description: What could a deal between the SNP and the Greens mean for Scottish government policies and priorities?

item.title: Snorkeler's close encounter with 9ft basking shark
item.description: Wildlife ranger Craig Nisbet said the harmless giant swam within a metre of him as it fed on zooplankton.

item.title: Will Scotland go back to traditional school exams?
item.description: Will Scottish school pupils be studying for traditional exams in 2022, or have things changed for good?

item.title: Green aviation: Electric powered plane trialled over Orkney
item.description: A hybrid-electric plane is being trialled in Orkney as part of a study into ways of reducing aviation emissions.

item.title: How have Scottish pupils found their results grading?
item.description: School pupils have had confirmation of their grades for qualifications including National 5s and Highers.

item.title: Glasgow TK Maxx flooded by torrential rain
item.description: A shopper in Glasgow captured the moment rain poured from the ceiling of a TK Maxx.

item.title: Torrential downpours and thunderstorms cause flooding across Scotland
item.description: Heavy showers and thunderstorms are causing severe flooding and travel disruption across Scotland.

item.title: Covid-19: Nicola Sturgeon on face coverings in Scotland's schools
item.description: Nicola Sturgeon explains why pupils and teachers will be required to wear face coverings in schools.

item.title: Gordon Strachan: Celtic will not delay short-term role for Dundee technical director
item.description: Celtic say there will be no delay in Gordon Strachan starting his short-term role as employing Dundee's technical director does not breach Scottish FA rules.

item.title: Rangers: Steven Gerrard vows to 'flip the mood' and go 'full throttle' against Dunfermline Athletic
item.description: Steven Gerrard says Rangers will go "full throttle" against Dunfermline Athletic in the Scottish League Cup as they look to bounce back from their Champions League exit.

item.title: Birmingham 2022: Laura Muir & Jemma Reekie likely to race at Commonwealth Games, says coach
item.description: Olympic stars Laura Muir and Jemma Reekie are likely to prioritise the Commonwealth Games in Birmingham next year amid a packed schedule, coach Andy Young says.

item.title: Scottish Gossip: Celtic, Rangers, Hearts, Dundee Utd, Morelos, Everton, Souttar, Porto, Fuchs, Juranovic, Henry, Henderson, Legia Warsaw
item.description: Celtic reportedly hold talks with Legia Warsaw right-back Josip Juranovic as Porto eye a cut-price deal for Rangers striker Alfredo Morelos.

item.title: Celtic v Jablonec: Ange Postecoglou 'not concerned' by Edouard's future
item.description: Celtic manager Ange Postecoglou says he is "not concerned" about Odsonne Edouard's future, but admits the club are worried the striker could leave for free next summer.
